partTitle: Work Visas and Green Card Pathways

workVisaPrograms.description: Temporary work visa for foreign nationals in specialty occupations requiring theoretical or technical expertise. Most common visa for professional employment in USA.

newPetitionFee.appliesTo: New H-1B petitions filed on or after effective date
exemptions: Cases where DHS Secretary determines hiring is in US national interest
Industry-wide or company-wide exemptions granted by Secretary
newPetitionFee.WARNING: This is a MAJOR CHANGE. $100,000 fee makes H-1B economically unfeasible for many petitions.
newPetitionFee.note: Presidential Proclamation issued September 19, 2025. This fee is IN ADDITION to regular filing fees.

acceptable: Foreign degree equivalent to U.S. bachelor's
Combination of education and experience (3 years work experience = 1 year university)
education.note: Degree must be in specific specialty related to the job

jobRequirements.specialty: Position must require theoretical or technical expertise in specialized field

DOL_minimum.note: Department of Labor minimum, but real minimum is usually much higher

salaryRequirement.actualRequirement: Must be paid prevailing wage OR employer's actual wage, whichever is HIGHER

prevailingWage.description: Salary paid to workers in similar occupations in same geographic area
prevailingWage.determination: Employer must obtain prevailing wage determination from DOL

lottery.selectionMethod: Random electronic lottery - weighted by salary level (higher salaries prioritized)
lottery.results: Usually announced in late March/early April
lottery.probability: Varies yearly - typically 25-40% selection rate depending on applications

capExemptions: Employment at universities and affiliated nonprofits

steps.title: Find Employer Willing to Sponsor
steps.description: Secure job offer from US employer willing to sponsor H-1B
actions: Apply to US companies that sponsor H-1B visas
Disclose need for H-1B sponsorship early in interview process
Consider companies known for H-1B sponsorship (tech companies, consulting firms)
challenges: Many employers reluctant due to cost and uncertainty
NEW: $100,000 fee makes sponsorship unlikely for most employers

steps.title: Labor Condition Application (LCA)
steps.description: Employer files LCA with Department of Labor
requirements: Employer attests to pay prevailing wage
Attest working conditions won't adversely affect US workers

steps.title: H-1B Registration (if cap-subject)
steps.description: Employer or attorney registers for H-1B lottery
steps.timeline: Usually March (exact dates announced by USCIS)
steps.note: Must wait for selection before filing full petition. If not selected, cannot file until next year.

steps.title: H-1B Petition Filing (Form I-129)
steps.description: Employer files H-1B petition with USCIS (only if selected in lottery or cap-exempt)
requiredDocuments: Evidence employer can pay offered wage

publicLaw114_113.condition: If employer has 50+ employees and 50%+ are H-1B/L-1 holders

NEW_2025_petitionFee.note: APPLIES TO NEW PETITIONS FILED AFTER SEPT 21, 2025
NEW_2025_petitionFee.warning: This makes H-1B prohibitively expensive for most cases

steps.title: USCIS Petition Processing
steps.description: USCIS reviews and adjudicates petition
possibleOutcomes: Request for Evidence (RFE) - additional documentation needed

steps.title: Visa Stamping (if outside US)
steps.description: If beneficiary is outside US, must obtain H-1B visa stamp at US Embassy/Consulate
steps.location: US Embassy Ankara or US Consulate Istanbul/Adana for Turkish citizens

steps.title: Entry to United States
steps.description: Enter US with H-1B visa and begin employment
steps.earliestStartDate: October 1st (for cap-subject petitions approved in current year)
steps.note: Can change employers with new H-1B petition while in US

conditions: If employer has started Green Card process (I-140 approved or PERM filed 365+ days ago)
Can extend in 1-3 year increments while waiting for Green Card
H-1B holder has approved I-140 (immigrant petition)
OR H-1B holder is in 6+ year H-1B extension status
workPermission.note: H-4 EAD (Employment Authorization Document) allows spouse to work

pathToGreenCard.process: Employer sponsors for EB-2 or EB-3 employment-based Green Card
pathToGreenCard.timeline: 2-6 years depending on category and country
pathToGreenCard.advantage: H-1B allows dual intent - can pursue Green Card while maintaining H-1B status
pathToGreenCard.note: See Green Card section below for details

turkishCitizenNotes.greenCardPriority: Turkey is in 'Rest of World' category - faster than India/China (can be years faster)
turkishCitizenNotes.communitySupport: Large Turkish professional community in tech hubs can help with job search
challenges: NEW $100,000 fee makes H-1B sponsorship very unlikely from September 2025
Lottery is unpredictable - no guarantee of selection
Most practical path: F-1 student visa → OPT → H-1B lottery → Green Card
Alternative: Transfer within multinational company using L-1 visa (see below)

alternatives: F-1 student visa with OPT/STEM OPT (3 years work authorization) then H-1B
L-1 visa (intracompany transfer) - no lottery, no cap
O-1 visa (extraordinary ability) - no lottery, no cap
EB-1 Green Card (direct permanent residence if highly qualified)
importantWarnings: CRITICAL: $100,000 petition fee effective Sept 21, 2025 makes H-1B economically unfeasible for most employers
H-1B is employer-specific - if you lose job, must find new sponsor quickly or leave US
Lottery is random - many qualified candidates never get selected
Processing times can be very long without premium processing
Cannot start work until October 1st (cap-subject cases)
H-1B denial rate has increased in recent years

workVisaPrograms.description: For employees of multinational companies transferring to US office. Includes executives, managers, and specialized knowledge workers.

advantages.note: Major advantage over H-1B - no annual quota or lottery

duration.initial: 3 years (1 year if opening new US office)

L1B.name: L-1B Specialized Knowledge
L1B.for: Workers with specialized knowledge of company's products, services, or procedures
L1B.note: USCIS applies strict standards - must demonstrate truly specialized knowledge

employmentHistory.required: Must have worked for foreign company for at least 1 continuous year in the last 3 years
employmentHistory.position: In managerial, executive, or specialized knowledge capacity
employmentHistory.note: Employment must be outside the US

companyRelationship.required: US company must be parent, subsidiary, affiliate, or branch of foreign company
companyRelationship.ownership: At least 50% common ownership and/or control
examples: Turkish employee of multinational transferring to US branch
Turkish startup establishing US presence and sending founders

L1A.executive: Directs organization or major component, establishes goals and policies

L1B.specializedKnowledge: Knowledge of company's product, service, research, systems, techniques, management, or procedures that is advanced and not readily available in US labor market

noEducationRequirement.note: Unlike H-1B, L-1 does NOT require bachelor's degree

steps.title: Establish Qualifying Relationship
steps.description: Ensure US and foreign companies have proper corporate relationship
requirements: US company must be actively doing business

steps.title: File L-1 Petition (Form I-129)
steps.description: US employer files petition with USCIS
requiredDocuments: Evidence of qualifying relationship between companies
Proof of beneficiary's employment abroad (1 year in last 3 years)
Business operations evidence for both companies

publicLaw114_113.condition: If employer has 50+ employees and 50%+ are H-1B/L-1 holders

NEW_2025_visaIntegrityFee.note: Starting FY2025, paid at visa issuance

steps.title: USCIS Adjudication
steps.description: USCIS reviews petition

steps.title: Visa Application at US Consulate (if outside US)
steps.description: Apply for L-1 visa stamp at US Embassy/Consulate in Turkey

blanketL1.description: For larger companies with frequent transfers - significantly faster process

requirements.companySize: Company must have US office for 1+ year AND meet criteria:
criteria: - $25 million in annual US sales, OR
- Obtained approval of 10+ L-1 petitions in past 12 months

EB1C.description: L-1A managers/executives can apply for EB-1C Green Card
EB1C.advantage: Usually current - no waiting period for Turkish citizens
EB1C.note: Very fast path to permanent residence

EB2_EB3.description: L-1B workers can pursue EB-2 or EB-3

turkishCitizenAdvantages: Excellent option for employees of Turkish companies expanding to US
Good for Turkish startups establishing US presence
Fast path to Green Card via EB-1C (for L-1A)
Can use if working for multinational company in Turkey (transfer to US office)

workVisaPrograms.officialName: O-1 Visa for Individuals with Extraordinary Ability
workVisaPrograms.description: For individuals who demonstrate extraordinary ability in sciences, arts, education, business, athletics, or extraordinary achievement in motion picture/TV industry

advantages.note: No annual quota or lottery - if you qualify, you can get it

categories.O1B: Arts, Motion Picture or Television Industry

eligibilityStandard.extraordinaryAbility: Level of expertise indicating that the person is one of the small percentage who have risen to the very top of the field
eligibilityStandard.note: VERY HIGH STANDARD - must be truly exceptional in your field

option1.title: Major International Award
option1.note: Very few people qualify through this route

option2.title: At least 3 of the following
criteria: Nationally or internationally recognized prizes or awards for excellence
Membership in associations requiring outstanding achievements (judged by recognized experts)
Published material about you in professional/major trade publications or media
Evidence of participation as a judge of others' work in your field
Original scientific, scholarly, artistic, athletic, or business-related contributions of major significance
Authorship of scholarly articles in professional journals or major media
Employment in a critical or essential capacity for organizations with distinguished reputation
High salary or remuneration compared to others in field
Other comparable evidence (if above criteria don't readily apply to your occupation)

applicationProcess.note: Must have US agent, employer, or sponsor, but more flexible than H-1B

steps.title: Gather Evidence
steps.description: Compile extensive documentation of extraordinary ability
documents: Publications about you (news articles, features, interviews)
Letters of recommendation from recognized experts in field
Evidence of membership in elite associations
steps.timeline: Several months to compile strong package

steps.title: Obtain Advisory Opinion
steps.description: Get consultation from peer group, labor organization, or expert in field
steps.note: USCIS wants opinion from relevant professional organization

steps.title: File O-1 Petition
steps.description: Employer/agent files Form I-129 with USCIS

steps.title: Visa Application (if outside US)
steps.description: Apply for O-1 visa at US Embassy/Consulate

totalCost.note: Plus attorney fees (highly recommended) - typically USD 3,000-8,000

duration.extensions: 1-year increments, unlimited extensions as long as you maintain extraordinary ability

EB1A.description: Can self-petition for EB-1A Green Card (same standard as O-1)
EB1A.timeline: Usually current for Turkish citizens - 1-2 years

EB2_NIW.description: National Interest Waiver - for those whose work benefits US

examplesOfQualification: PhD researchers with significant publications and citations
Artists with major exhibitions or performances
Business executives with track record of major achievements
turkishCitizenNotes: Good option for highly accomplished Turkish professionals
Can lead to self-petitioned Green Card (EB-1A)
High bar - must have significant achievements and recognition
Often used by researchers, professors, tech leaders, artists

categories.name: First Preference - Priority Workers

EB1A.name: Extraordinary Ability
EB1A.description: Persons with extraordinary ability in sciences, arts, education, business, or athletics
requirements: Must demonstrate sustained national or international acclaim
Major international award OR meet 3 of 10 criteria (same as O-1)
EB1A.advantage: NO employer sponsorship needed - can self-petition

currentPriorityDate.note: Turkish citizens (Rest of World) - no waiting period as of November 2025

EB1B.name: Outstanding Professors and Researchers
EB1B.description: For professors and researchers recognized internationally
requirements: At least 3 years teaching or research experience
Entering US to pursue tenure/tenure-track teaching or comparable research position
Meet 2 of 6 criteria (major awards, membership in associations, published material about you, etc.)

currentPriorityDate.note: No waiting period for Turkish citizens

EB1C.name: Multinational Manager or Executive
EB1C.description: Managers/executives transferring from foreign company to US
requirements: Worked for foreign company 1 of last 3 years in managerial/executive capacity
Coming to US to work for same employer (or affiliate) in managerial/executive capacity
Often used by L-1A visa holders
EB1C.advantage: Excellent path for L-1A holders - fast and usually current

categories.overallAdvantage: EB-1 is CURRENT for Turkish citizens - no multi-year wait
categories.note: High qualification bar but fastest path to Green Card if you qualify

categories.name: Second Preference - Advanced Degree or Exceptional Ability
categories.description: Professionals with advanced degrees or exceptional ability

currentPriorityDate.waitTime: Approximately 2 years backlog as of November 2025
currentPriorityDate.note: Much faster than India (8+ years) or China (3+ years)

requirements.option1: Advanced degree (Master's or higher) AND job requiring advanced degree
requirements.option2: Bachelor's degree + 5 years progressive experience in specialty
requirements.option3: Exceptional ability in sciences, arts, or business (must meet 3 of 6 criteria)

process.step1: PERM Labor Certification - employer must prove no qualified US workers available (6-12 months)
process.step3: Wait for priority date to become current (2 years for Turkish citizens as of Nov 2025)
process.step4: File I-485 Adjustment of Status or immigrant visa application (8-12 months)

EB2_NIW.name: National Interest Waiver
EB2_NIW.description: Waiver of job offer and labor certification if work is in US national interest
requirements: AND: Work is in US national interest
Must show: (1) substantial merit and national importance, (2) well-positioned to advance endeavor, (3) beneficial to waive job offer requirement
EB2_NIW.advantage: NO employer needed, NO labor certification
EB2_NIW.note: Increasingly popular option for skilled Turkish professionals

I485_adjustment.note: Per person, plus fees for dependents

totalEstimate.note: Including attorney fees, typically paid by employer

categories.name: Third Preference - Skilled Workers and Professionals
categories.description: Skilled workers, professionals, and other workers

currentPriorityDate.note: Slightly longer wait than EB-2 but lower qualification requirements

skilledWorker.education: Bachelor's degree OR 2 years job training/experience

professional.examples: Teachers, business analysts, accountants with degree requirement

otherWorker.note: Much longer wait times (can be 7-10+ years)

categories.process: Same as EB-2: PERM → I-140 → Wait for priority date → I-485
categories.note: Lower requirements than EB-2 but longer wait. Good for bachelor's degree holders without 5 years experience.

turkishCitizenAdvantage.priorityDateStatus: Turkey is in 'Rest of World' category

comparison.note: HUGE advantage over India and China

turkishCitizenAdvantage.EB1_current: EB-1 categories are CURRENT - no wait for Turkish citizens
turkishCitizenAdvantage.recommendation: If you qualify for EB-1, pursue it. If not, EB-2 NIW is excellent self-petition option.

greenCardPrograms.description: Annual lottery providing up to 55,000 immigrant visas to persons from countries with low immigration rates to USA

turkishCitizenEligibility.note: Turkey is eligible for DV Lottery

education.option1: High school diploma or equivalent (12 years of formal education)
education.option2: 2 years work experience within past 5 years in occupation requiring at least 2 years training/experience

steps.title: Online Registration
steps.description: Submit electronic entry during registration period
requiredInfo: Name, date of birth, place of birth
Photo meeting strict requirements (600x600 pixels, recent, specific format)
steps.note: ONE entry per person. Multiple entries = disqualification. Keep confirmation number.

steps.title: Check Results
steps.description: Check if selected via Entrant Status Check
steps.selectionRate: Very low - typically less than 1% of applicants
steps.note: ONLY official website - beware of scams

steps.title: If Selected: Submit DS-260 and Documents
steps.description: Complete immigrant visa application

steps.title: Visa Interview
steps.description: Attend interview at US Embassy Ankara or Istanbul
steps.timeline: Between October and September of fiscal year
steps.note: Must complete process before September 30th deadline - no extensions

steps.title: Receive Green Card
steps.description: If approved, receive immigrant visa and enter US
steps.note: Must enter US before visa expires (usually 6 months)

probability.note: Lottery is purely random. Turkish selection rate varies by year.
probability.recommendation: Apply every year (free) but don't rely on it as primary strategy

familyMembers.note: Must list all family members on initial entry - can't add later

importantWarnings: Beware of scams - official entry is FREE and only via dvprogram.state.gov
Don't pay anyone to 'increase your chances' - it's a random lottery
Only ONE entry per person - multiple entries = automatic disqualification
Must meet strict photo requirements - incorrect photo = disqualification
If selected, you MUST complete process by September 30 deadline - no exceptions
Selection doesn't guarantee visa - must still meet requirements and pass interview
turkishCitizenNotes: Free to try every year - no downside
Very low probability but offers direct path to Green Card
Can apply while on other visas (F-1, H-1B, etc.) - DV lottery doesn't affect current status
If selected, provides path to Green Card without employer sponsorship
Good 'backup' option while pursuing other immigration paths

timeline.marriedToUSC: 3 years if married to US citizen

physicalPresence.5yearPath: Must be physically present in US for at least 30 months out of 5 years
physicalPresence.3yearPath: Must be physically present for at least 18 months out of 3 years

continuousResidence.trips: No single trip over 6 months (or will break continuous residence)
continuousResidence.note: Trips over 6 months raise presumption of abandoning residence

otherRequirements: Lived in state/USCIS district for at least 3 months before applying
Good moral character (no serious crimes, no fraud, pay taxes)
Basic English reading, writing, speaking ability
Pass civics test (U.S. history and government)
Oath of allegiance to the United States

process.timeline: 8-14 months from application to oath ceremony

dualCitizenship.note: USA allows dual citizenship. Turkey also allows dual citizenship. Turkish citizens who become US citizens CAN keep Turkish citizenship.
dualCitizenship.benefit: Can maintain ties to Turkey while enjoying US citizenship benefits

totalTimeline.minimum: 6-7 years from Green Card to citizenship (5 years + 8-14 months processing)
